Its very unlike the original. While the original is very much an action horror game, this game is much easier, but is justified by the better atmosphere and really cool action-movie stuff you get to do. This is much more cinematic in the sense of scale of your actions.

BTW this doesn't include the 2 episodes or is the set of them. The episodes are actually sequels to this game.

If you don't want to get Half-Life 1 then all you need to know is that many of the aliens found in this game were released by an experiment Gordon Freeman  worked on at Black Mesa.  At the end of the first game, Gordon Freeman gets recruited by G-Man. No I don't know what that means but from what I can tell Gordon has been recruited by an organization even higher than the illuminati.

[h1]"El Principio del Fin"[/h1]

Half-Life 2, ocurre 20 a√±os despu√©s de lo sucedido en el primer juego y sus expansiones, en donde Gordon Freeman llega (por el contrato presentado por G-Man) a "Ciudad 17" estando √©l en animaci√≥n suspendida en todo ese tiempo. Durante 20 a√±os, se nos comenta que "Nihilanth" (el boss final de half life 1) no era el "villano", si no que era una facci√≥n rebelde de la raza conocida como "Combine" o la "Alianza". Luego de su muerte a manos de nosotros, los Combine descubrieron la Tierra, en lo que iniciaron una invasi√≥n total, lo cual conquistaron el planeta en 7 horas, la poblacion mundial se redujo drasticamente, se coloc√≥ un campo de supresi√≥n que evita la reproducci√≥n humana y la sociedad se organiz√≥ en ciudades numeradas, en donde "Ciudad 17" es el centro de operaciones Combine en la Tierra. Luego de nuestra llegada, conocemos a la resistencia humana, que est√° preprandose para una rebeli√≥n abierta contra los combine por el control de las ciudades, y el mundo.

Como una leyenda en nuestra partida, y un h√©roe en el campo de batalla, debemos liderar esa rebeli√≥n.

Half-Life 2, fue lanzado en el a√±o 2004, presentando una mejora gr√°fica impresionante (implementando el nuevo motor "Source" algo modificado) y un motor de fisicas "Havok". Nuevas armas y m√©canicas con ellas (como la gravity-gun), mapas m√°s din√°micos a la hora de combatir, la implementacion de vehiculos y elementos para mejorar la narrativa dentro del juego ya que al igual que los juegos anteriores carece de cinem√°ticas como tal.

Sin embargo, presenta fallos en algunos c√°lculos de f√≠sicas, el motor gr√°fico presenta un bajo poligonaje (y esto se nota en las numerosas pantallas de carga a lo largo del juego), la IA de los npc's aliados es algo "tonta" ya que no trazan bien las rutas de seguimiento en algunos mapas. Esto se nota m√°s ahora, pero siendo un juego con ya 13 a√±os en su √©poca fue un salto gigantesco en todos los sentidos.

Esta entrega, presenta s√≥lamente 2 continuaciones m√°s: Half-Life 2: Episodio 1 y el Episodio 2.

Un juegazo, bien largo en su duraci√≥n y lo disfrut√© muchisimo cuando lo jugu√© por primera vez.

Gaben: Rather than offer you the illusion of free choice, I will take the liberty of choosing for you... if and when your time comes round again. I do apologize for what must seem to you an arbitrary imposition, Dr. Freeman. I trust it will all make sense to you in the course of... well... I'm really not at liberty to say. In the meantime... this is where I get off.

This is a great basic sci-fi shooter. I say basic because there's no stupid abilities- like Halo 5's (awful) thrusters or Dishonored's rune powers. This is an example of how you don't need the power to go invisible or hover mid-air to have fun playing a game, which is awesome because I find that ALL games nowadays have powers- as I mentioned. However, I don't understand why Half-Life has such a HUGE cult following. Yes, It IS fun and has an interesting story but I don't think it's a legendary or godly game. I still like it though, so It's a 'thumbs up' from me... even though it's ¬£6.99 in the UK (It'd be a better price at roughly... ¬£4.99 or ¬£5.99 at MOST).

This is the defining story driven FPS. There's no multiplayer, just the singleplayer. Great story, great gunplay, interesting puzzles. This was a great successor to the original Half-Life and still looks great today.
Fantastic experience, sadly with no clear ending. Where is that ship Borealis for f**k sake!

HALF-LIFE 2<

The long awaited sequal to half-life came in 2004. The game was a hit for fans of the original and brought some new elements and features to the battlefield. The plot takes place two decades after the black mesa incident and earth is under siege by a seemingly unstoppable alien race, the combine.

PROS:
-The story is very well paced and put together very nicely as all the others. You play as Gordon Freeman again during the aftermath of earths defeat in the Seven Hour War. Not spoiling the rest in case you haven't picked up a copy in the 10 years its existed.
-The environment is very immersive as it is a long seamless road to the end of the game with, as the definition of seamless implies, zero cutscenes or immersion breaking interruptions.
-The gunplay involves the same weapons from half-life with plentiful new additions such as a combine rifle and different grenades. The arsenal available is pleasently loud, very powerful feeling, and quite fun to use when eliminating the enemy as per tradition.
-The game gives players a little down time after a while with some dialogue heavy playable "cutscene" like segments. Four in total.
-New engine means new physics, and new physics means a whole new realm of puzzling to do.
-The ending is fantastic with closing out the game but certainly could have been better.

CONS: (Not even half-life is safe from sin, sorry) Please note that i am extremely aware that this game is sorta old.
-Controls feel less floaty than half-life 1 but there's still some slip n sliding.
-The combine is a painfully easy enemy throughout the entire game and even when their ranks change.
-Cutscenes are replaced with you being essentially trapped in a box and forced to listen to dialogue every playthrough. There are four instances of this happening throughout the game but all are spread vastly apart from eachother.
-The games puzzles and other logic based conundrums are bonehead easy and will just seem like annoyances on successive playthroughs. Sad part being this seems to be the games only ace in the hole as it will sometimes FORCE mundane puzzles(hope you like box stacking) on the player in order to continue.

This game is about as much of a must have as the first one. I picked the entire series up in a frantic buy in a summer sale and it was worth it. The game is very replayable to me, i went through it about twice a year ever since i picked up the orange box for the xbox 360. The game has some very valid criticisms from fans of the original and while i see almost all of them i still can't help but come back. if anything it's textures for gmod if you don't have much interest in it.

Half-Life 2 is probably one of the most impactful gaming experiences I've ever had. It's a fantastic game that deserves to be played at least once, a true classic. The storyline is stellar, the characters are compelling, the lore is very intriguing. The gameplay fun, although not the best attribute of this game. The soundtrack is very good too. I recommend it alongside all singleplayer Valve games.
